event.title: brought their herds to Huntington Creek in 1875

data.event: The first settlers of European extraction in the area were four stockmen, Leander Lemmon, James McHadden, Bill Gentry, and Alfred Starr, who brought their herds to Huntington Creek in 1875.

event.title: fall of 1877, in response to the same call from The Church of Jesus Christ of Latter-day Saints that brought

data.event: In the fall of 1877, in response to the same call from The Church of Jesus Christ of Latter-day Saints that brought settlers to the other creeks in Castle Valley, a small group from Fairview, Utah, under the leadership of Elias Cox, established a dugout colony on the banks of Huntington Creek and began digging irrigation canals.
The colony grew from 126 in 1880 to 738 in 1890 and 1,293 in 1910.
